name: Lemon Rice
history: Lemon Rice is a popular South Indian dish often served as a quick meal or a temple prasadam. It's known for its tangy and refreshing flavor, primarily coming from the addition of lemon juice to the rice.
description: Lemon Rice is a vibrant and flavorful dish made with cooked rice, lemon juice, and tempered with spices like mustard seeds, chilies, and curry leaves. It's a simple yet delicious meal, often accompanied by pickles or yogurt.

equipment.name: large bowl
equipment.description: For mixing the rice with lemon juice and tempered spices.

instructions.title: Temper the Spices
instructions.description: Heat oil in a frying pan. Add mustard seeds, urad dal, chana dal, green chilies, curry leaves, peanuts, and a pinch of asafoetida. Fry until the dals turn golden brown.

instructions.title: Mix Rice with Lemon Juice
instructions.description: In a large bowl, mix the cooked rice with turmeric powder, salt, and lemon juice.

instructions.title: Combine Rice with Tempered Spices
instructions.description: Add the tempered spices to the rice. Mix gently, ensuring the rice is evenly coated with the spices and lemon juice.

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Garnish with chopped coriander leaves. Serve the lemon rice hot or at room temperature.

tips: Use leftover rice or cook the rice in advance to ensure it is not too soft or mushy.
Adjust the quantity of lemon juice based on your taste preference.
variations: Add cashews instead of peanuts for a different texture.
Include vegetables like grated carrots or peas for added nutrition.

storage.shelfLife: Can be refrigerated for up to 1 day.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat in a microwave or on a stove until warm.
presentationTips: Serve in a colorful bowl with a side of raita or plain yogurt.
Garnish with additional lemon wedges for a fresh look.
